item.title: [PI] JackPot Mini-Game[PI]
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

This?

[code]
import java.util.Scanner;

public class rsps {
public static void main(String [] args) {

            int number;
           
            Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);

            System.out.print("Guess the ammount in the Pot.");
            System.out.println("If you get the number right you earn that amount of cash!");
            System.out.println("Hint: Its between 30M and 90M");               
            number = in.nextInt();
           
            if(number == 50000000){
				System.out.println("you are awesome! You picked the right ammount");
                System.out.println("You got " + number + " cash!");
                System.out.println("You are The JackPot Winner!");
            } else {
				System.out.println("You picked " + number + " cash");
				System.out.println("You guessed wrong");
			}
    }

}[/code]
Or this:

[code]
import java.util.Scanner;

public class rsps {
public static void main(String [] args) {

            int number;
           
            Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);

            System.out.print("Guess the ammount in the Pot.");
            System.out.println("If you get the number right you earn that amount of cash!");
            System.out.println("Hint: Its between 3 and 9");               
            number = in.nextInt();
           
            if(number == Math.round((Math.random*6)+3).intValue()){
				System.out.println("you are awesome! You picked the right ammount");
                System.out.println("You got " + number + " cash!");
                System.out.println("You are The JackPot Winner!");
            } else {
				System.out.println("You picked " + number + " cash");
				System.out.println("You guessed wrong");
			}
    }

}[/code]

item.title: [PI] JackPot Mini-Game[PI]
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

He’s off, but I think he wants this:

If they pick 500,000,000 they get 500,000,000.
If they pick any other number, they get it wrong, and it sends them a message that says they were wrong. That’s what I got away from his introduction.

item.title: [PI] JackPot Mini-Game[PI]
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

If you want it for the server, then why are you using System.out.println? As a test i’m guessing? I don’t understand what you even are trying to do with this file on it’s own…Here… Explain to me what you want the minigame to do.

[code=java]import java.util.Scanner;

public class rsps {
public static void main(String [] args) {

            int number;
			
            Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);

			System.out.println("Guess the ammount in the Pot.");
			System.out.println("If you get the number right you earn that ammount of cash!");
			System.out.println("Hint: Its between 30M and 90M");      
			
            number = in.nextInt();
			
            if(number < 50000000) {//This says if the number that they enter is under 5000000, then they guessed wrong.
				System.out.println("You picked " + number + "");
				System.out.println("You guessed wrong.");
			} else if(number > 50000000) {//If the number is over 5000000 then they picked right.
				System.out.println("You are awesome! You picked the right ammount.");
                                    System.out.println("You got " + number + " cash!");
                                    System.out.println("You are The JackPot Winner!");
                           }else if(number == 50000000) {//If they picked 50000000 then they win too..
				System.out.println("You are awesome! You picked the right ammount.");
				System.out.println("You got " + number + " cash!");
				System.out.println("You are The JackPot Winner!");
                    
            
            }
    }

}[/code]

item.title: [PI] JackPot Mini-Game[PI]
item.dc:creator: @I_am_beast I am beast
item.description:
@I_am_beast wrote:

Try this:

[code]
import java.util.Scanner;

public class rsps {
public static void main(String [] args) {

            int number;
           
            Scanner in = new Scanner(System.in);

            System.out.print("Guess the amount in the Pot.");
            System.out.println("If you get the number right you earn that amount of cash!");
            System.out.println("Hint: Its between 30M and 90M");               
                            number = in.nextInt();

if(number == 50000000){
System.out.println(“You are awesome! You picked the right amount”);
System.out.println(“You got " + number + " cash!”);
System.out.println(“You are The JackPot Winner!”);
}else if(number !== 50000000){
System.out.println(“You picked " + number + " cash”);
System.out.println(“You guessed wrong”);
return;
}

    }

}[/code]

Don’t know if that would work. Worth a shot though.
